intro: Quercus macranthera subsp. syspirensis, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a deciduous tree native to central Mexico. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in autumn. The tree produces acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It typically grows in dry to moist forests and thrives in well-drained soils. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological importance in its native habitat.
